key.name: swap-up-window
key.summary: Swap current window with window above.

key.name: swap-down-window
key.summary: Swap current window with window below.

key.name: swap-left-window
key.summary: Swap current window with window to the left.

key.name: swap-right-window
key.summary: Swap current window with window to the right.

key.name: inner-gap
key.summary: The gap between windows in pixels.

key.name: outer-gap-horizontal
key.summary: The gap to the left and right screen edges.

key.name: outer-gap-vertical
key.summary: The gap to the top and bottom screen edges.

key.name: new-window-behavior
key.description: Determines if a new window is added as primary or stack window.

key.name: tiling-enabled
key.description: When disabled, stops automatic tiling of new windows while preserving existing layout.

key.name: respect-maximized-windows
key.description: When enabled, skip tiling operations while any window is maximized. When disabled, force all windows to tile (current behavior).

key.name: exceptions-always-center
key.description: When enabled, non-tiled (exception) windows will be automatically centered on their monitor when created.

key.name: exceptions-always-on-top
key.summary: Always on top for exception windows
key.description: When enabled, non-tiled (exception) windows will stay above tiled windows.

key.name: debug-logging
key.description: When enabled, extension logs detailed information to GNOME Shell journal for troubleshooting. View logs with: journalctl -f -o cat /usr/bin/gnome-shell

key.name: default-exceptions
key.description: Built-in applications excluded from tiling. Updated with the extension.

key.name: custom-exceptions
key.description: User-added applications excluded from tiling. Persists across extension updates.
